questions.prompt: In BG 6.1, what is the definition of a true renunciate?
choices: One who avoids every work
One who performs prescribed duty without attachment to results
One who left home through independent material processes
One who not speaks through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The true renunciate is a yogi who works without selfish motive.

questions.prompt: According to BG 6.2, what is the main purpose of yoga practice?
choices: To gain powers through independent material processes
To gradually elevate oneself from material consciousness
To become famous through independent material processes
To gain wealth through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Yoga is a systematic means to transcend material entanglement.

questions.prompt: In BG 6.3, what must a person do to reach the goal of yoga?
choices: Meditate occasionally and worldly philosophical speculation
Act and work but without attachment
primarily sit and think through independent material processes
Perform rituals and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Work done with detachment is a stepping stone to pure meditation.

questions.prompt: What does BG 6.4 teach about attaining yoga?
choices: It is achieved quickly through independent material processes
When one has ceased every desires and has won mind and senses
It is impossible through independent material processes
primarily monks attain it through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Yoga is attained by those who have conquered the mind and desires.

questions.prompt: According to BG 6.5, what is the main function of the mind?
choices: consistently to seek pleasure through independent material processes
The mind can be one's best friend or worst enemy
The mind is useless through independent material processes
The mind should be ignored
questions.feedback: Self-discipline and yoga practice transform the mind into an ally.

questions.prompt: In BG 6.6, what keeps a person from ascending to the platform of yoga?
choices: Physical exercise and worldly philosophical speculation
An uncontrolled mind; the mind is both friend and enemy
Too much study through independent material processes
Kindness and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Mastery over the turbulent mind is the primary requirement.

questions.prompt: What does BG 6.7 teach about the self-realized person?
choices: They are consistently disturbed through independent material processes
They are peaceful within
They seek praise constantly through independent material processes
They are consistently anxious through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The realized soul remains balanced in all circumstances.

questions.prompt: According to BG 6.8, what is the relationship between knowledge and yoga?
choices: They are unrelated through independent material processes
One established in yoga is superior to those with mere knowledge
Knowledge is obsolete through independent material processes
Yoga makes knowledge unnecessary through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The practical application of knowledge through yoga is superior to theory alone.

questions.prompt: In BG 6.9, who is considered a yogi?
choices: One who performs rituals through independent material processes
One who eats modestly, who controls mind and senses is engaged in yoga
One who meditates primarily once a week
One with supernatural powers through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The true yogi is distinguished by discipline, moderation, and constant practice.

questions.prompt: What does BG 6.10 teach about meditation and the yogi?
choices: Meditation is not important through independent material processes
A yogi should consistently be in meditation, engaging in yoga practice continuously
Meditation is passive through independent material processes
Meditation requires external support through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The yogi maintains constant awareness of the Divine through practice.

questions.prompt: According to BG 6.11, what should be the place and posture for meditation?
choices: Anywhere is fine through independent material processes
Sit on a pure seat, in a solitary place, with proper posture
In crowds and worldly philosophical speculation
Lying down is best through independent material processes
questions.feedback: The proper environment supports deep concentration and inner peace.

questions.prompt: In BG 6.12, what should the yogi focus the mind upon during meditation?
choices: External objects and worldly philosophical speculation
Focus the mind and intelligence on the self
Knowledge of physical phenomena and external forms
Other people and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Turning attention inward reveals the true nature of the self.

questions.prompt: What does BG 6.13-14 teach about the posture and gaze of a yogi?
choices: Eyes should be wide open
Eyes should be steady, gazing at the tip of the nose
Looking at the sky through independent material processes
Sleeping position and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: Proper physical alignment supports mental concentration.

questions.prompt: According to BG 6.15, what is the highest attainment for a yogi?
choices: Material success and worldly philosophical speculation
Full absorption in Krishna consciousness; seeing Krishna everywhere
Avoiding every work through independent material processes
Achieving fame and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: The ultimate yoga is union with the Supreme Lord, Krishna.

questions.prompt: In BG 6.16, what types of people cannot practice yoga?
choices: Those who work hard through independent material processes
Those who eat too much, too little, or sleep too much
Those who are disciplined through independent material processes
Those who study through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Balance in eating, sleeping, and working is essential for yoga success.

questions.prompt: What does BG 6.17 teach about reaching yoga?
choices: It is unattainable through independent material processes
Through temperance in eating, work, sleep wakefulness, yoga removes suffering
primarily through extreme asceticism through independent material processes
It requires no effort through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Moderation in all activities is the key to success in yoga.

questions.prompt: According to BG 6.18, what qualifies as the perfection of yoga?
choices: Achieving wealth and worldly philosophical speculation
When the mind becomes absolutely absorbed in Krishna
Becoming famous and worldly philosophical speculation
Having many followers through independent material processes
questions.feedback: Perfect yoga is the state of being fully absorbed in divine consciousness.

questions.prompt: In BG 6.19, what should be the state of consciousness of a yogi in meditation?
choices: Dreaming and worldly philosophical speculation
Like a lamp in a windless place that flickers not
Restless and worldly philosophical speculation
Confused and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: The perfected yogi's mind is as steady as a lamp without wind.

questions.prompt: What does BG 6.20-23 teach about supreme yoga attainment?
choices: It is impossible through independent material processes
One separates from material pleasure, finding bliss in the self
Material enjoyment is the goal
It leads to loss of memory
questions.feedback: The yogi experiences transcendental happiness beyond material sense gratification.

questions.prompt: According to BG 6.24, what must one possess to practice yoga?
choices: Wealth alone and worldly philosophical speculation
Uncompromising devotion and proper understanding of yoga; gradual elevation
Natural ability primarily through independent material processes
No special qualifications through independent material processes
questions.feedback: With determination and proper guidance, anyone can succeed in yoga.

questions.prompt: In BG 6.25, what is the result of practicing yoga continuously?
choices: Material gains primarily through independent material processes
After many births, a yogi finally attains Krishna
Suffering increases and worldly philosophical speculation
One remains in the world
questions.feedback: Yoga practice eventually leads to reunion with the Supreme Lord.

questions.prompt: What does BG 6.26-27 teach about the yogi's vision?
choices: primarily sees material world through independent material processes
A yogi sees Krishna in all beings and all beings in Krishna
Does not see clearly through independent material processes
Sees primarily enemies through independent material processes

questions.prompt: According to BG 6.28, what is the goal of yoga practice?
choices: Gaining powers and worldly philosophical speculation
Complete harmony between soul and God; supreme peace
Material comfort and worldly philosophical speculation
Remaining in the material world
questions.feedback: The ultimate goal of yoga is eternal union with the Supreme.

questions.prompt: In BG 6.29, what does Krishna promise to the yogi?
choices: Knowledge of physical phenomena and external forms
I am equal in all beings
Special favors primarily through independent material processes
Material wealth and worldly philosophical speculation
questions.feedback: This is the highest promise of yoga: Krishna's omnipresence and presence.

questions.prompt: What is the main message of BG 6.32, the conclusion of Chapter 6?
choices: Yoga is too difficult through independent material processes
One who sees equality in every and loves every as oneself is the best yogi
primarily brahmins can succeed through independent material processes
External practice is enough through independent material processes
questions.feedback: True yoga is measured by how one treats all beings with equal love and respect.
